sentences.english: In the hall, the shallow challenger shall be allowed to swallow the swallows.
sentences.chinese: 在大厅里，浮浅得挑衅者将被容许吞下燕子。

sentences.english: The respirations are rapid, shallow and grunting, counting 40 a minute.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸快，浮浅，并且发出咕噜声，一分钟有40次。

sentences.english: His understanding of his mistake is rather superficial.
sentences.chinese: 他对错误的认识比较浮浅。

sentences.english: I heard that Green Island has good snorkeling.
sentences.chinese: 我听说在绿岛浮浅很不错。

sentences.english: I already began to feel that much of what the world was seeking was superficial.
sentences.chinese: 我开始觉得很多世间所追寻的东西是很浮浅的。

sentences.english: shallow men believe in luck. self-trust is the first secret of success.
sentences.chinese: 浮浅的人相信运气，而成功的第一秘诀是自信。

definition: to float about/(of a feeling) to show on the face/(of speech, friendship etc) shallow/vague
to come to the surface/to become apparent
lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
empty cave, nothing there (idiom); devoid of substance/nothing new to show
